issue.title: Add top-level permissions to cherry-picker and remove-labels.yml

labels.name: team-OSS
labels.description: Issues for the Bazel OSS team: installation, release processBazel packaging, website

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Fixes #20086.

As described in the issue, this PR adds read-only permissions to bazel's workflows that don't yet have them. This reduces the risk of supply-chain attacks via the project's CI/CD infrastructure.

My understanding is that `cherry-picker.yml` does not require any additional permissions since everything done by `bazelbuild/continuous-integration/actions/cherry_picker` uses the declared `GH_TOKEN` instead of the workflow's default `GITHUB_TOKEN`. If I'm mistaken, let me know and I'll happy fix the PR.

issue.title: [7.0.0] Add top-level permissions to cherry-picker and remove-labels.yml

labels.name: team-OSS
labels.description: Issues for the Bazel OSS team: installation, release processBazel packaging, website

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Fixes #20086.

As described in the issue, this PR adds read-only permissions to bazel's workflows that don't yet have them. This reduces the risk of supply-chain attacks via the project's CI/CD infrastructure.

My understanding is that `cherry-picker.yml` does not require any additional permissions since everything done by `bazelbuild/continuous-integration/actions/cherry_picker` uses the declared `GH_TOKEN` instead of the workflow's default `GITHUB_TOKEN`. If I'm mistaken, let me know and I'll happy fix the PR.

Closes #20087.

Commit https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/ba61ff7d2eb6ed697e12abe3688992e85c434b30

PiperOrigin-RevId: 580542813
Change-Id: Ib45164ea8d9c0aa583e91d316ad2b552f3c9b5b7

body: A fix for this issue has been included inÂ [Bazel 7.0.0 RC5](https://releases.bazel.build/7.0.0/rc5/index.html). Please test out the release candidate and report any issues as soon as possible. Thanks!

Hi @pnacht, I saw this issue mentioned in this blog post https://cycode.com/blog/cycode-discovers-a-supply-chain-vulnerability-in-bazel/

Wanted to mention that those jobs were already running the harden-runner GitHub Action. 
https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/actions/runs/7745839239/workflow#L20-L23
https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/blob/master/.github/workflows/remove-labels.yml#L16-L19

You can view outbound calls made by that workflow for past runs to confirm no unexpected calls/ exfiltration attempts happened. 
https://app.stepsecurity.io/github/bazelbuild/bazel/actions/runs/7741733879

I looked it up and only calls to these destinations have been observed in the last 240 odd runs. 
api.github.com:443
files.pythonhosted.org:443
github.com:443
pypi.org:443
